Class MasterRecords

  • java.lang.Object
    • MasterRecords
  • public class MasterRecords
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores user file records into a HashMap of users mapped to a HashMap of the user's files. Files are stored using FileInfo instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MasterRecords​(java.lang.String logFilePath)
      Class constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MasterRecords

        public MasterRecords​(java.lang.String logFilePath)
        Class constructor. Loads data from file with specified name if it exists. If the file does not exist, it is created.
        Parameters:
        logFilePath - the path of the file to use for storing and loading user file records

    • Method Detail

      • getUserMap

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​FileInfo>> getUserMap()
        Returns the underlying ConcurrentHashMap instance used to store user records. This is the most cumbersome way to manage records user records.
        Returns:
        the HashMap containing all user info for this server

      • addUser

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​FileInfo> addUser​(java.lang.String username)
        Adds a user to the record HashMap.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to add
        Returns:
        the HashMap of file info for that user

      • putUserFileInfo

        public FileInfo putUserFileInfo​(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String filename,
                                long filesize,
                                java.lang.String date,
                                java.lang.String path,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> nodeSet)
        Adds entries into the HashMap for the information provided. If a user with the specified username does not exist, it is added. If a file with said filename in this user's record does not exist, it is created. If the file does exist, it is replaced with the provided information. Also saves this current set of records to the records file.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user whose file info is being added
        filename - name of the file being added
        filesize - size of the file being added
        date - date that the file was created. Should be formatted correctly.
        path - the path representing where a data node will store this file
        nodeSet - the set of nodes that contain this file. The set is converted to a synchronized set and must not contain null values.
        Returns:
        returns the FileInfo object created to store the provided information.

      • getFileNodes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getFileNodes​(java.lang.String username,
                                                    java.lang.String filename)
        Gets the nodes that a specified file is stored on.
        Parameters:
        username - username associated with the file to check
        filename - name of the file to check
        Returns:
        the set of nodes that contain this file

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists​(java.lang.String username,
                          java.lang.String filename)
        Checks to see if a file matching the provided information exists.
        Parameters:
        username - username associated with file to check
        filename - name of the file to check
        Returns:
        returns true if the file exists, false otherwise

      • getFileInfo

        public FileInfo getFileInfo​(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String filename)
        Gets the FileInfo object for a specified file, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        username - username associated with the file
        filename - name of the file
        Returns:
        the FileInfo object for the file, or null if it is not found

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String filename)
        Remove the entry for the specified file if it exists. On successful deletion, saves this current set of records to the specified records file.
        Parameters:
        username - username associated with the file to delete
        filename - name of file to delete

      • getNodeFileList

        public java.lang.String getNodeFileList​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets a list of files that should be stored on the specified node.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - node to retrieve file list for
        Returns:
        line delimited list of files the specified node should have, or an empty string.

      • getUserFileList

        public java.lang.String getUserFileList​(java.lang.String username)
        Returns a list of files belonging to a user. File information is comma-delimited and files are double-colon-delimited. For example, "filename,size,formattedDate::filename,1234,formattedDate::"...
        Parameters:
        username - username of user whose files to list
        Returns:
        list of files belonging to the specified user
